feed.title: 红顔生白发，痴心却不老

entry.title: add scala library to sbt project
entry.content:
Add scala librarys to sbt project

I create a sbt code, add a sbt eclipse plugin to build.sbt, and turn the project to a eclipse project.

In eclipse, I add the the scala libraries(under my scala home) to the project, I write some actor code use the scala-actors.jar library, and it works fine in eclipse.

But when I compile the code in sbt, it complains missing some classes. Seems I need to add these libraries for sbt in build.sbt or project/Build.scala.

Solution: add below code to build.sbt

libraryDependencies <++= (scalaVersion)(sv =>
    Seq(
        "org.scala-lang" % "scala-library" % sv,
        "org.scala-lang" % "scala-swing" % sv,
        "org.scala-lang" % "scala-actors" % sv,
        "org.scala-lang" % "scala-reflect" % sv
    )
)

Of course I defined scalaVersion to 2.10.3 in build.sbt, after that, invoke update action in sbt, then compile the code, it should work fine too.

entry.title: Something confused in SBT and the build.sbt file
entry.content:
I created a sbt project, in build.sbt, I set the scalaVersion to 2.10.2, as I want to learn akka, I add the akka dependency:

libraryDependencies += "com.typesafe.akka" % "akka-actor" % "2.2.3"

It worked fine!

Then I want to write some code to try Spark, so I add

libraryDependencies += "org.apache.spark" % "spark-core_2.9.3" % "0.8.0-incubating"

When I use the ‘sbt update’ command to update the dependencies, it broken. Now I know as it indicated in the artifactId, it’s for scala 2.9.3, as it’s the latest version of spark.

I should change the scalaVersion AND I NEED TO change akka-actor’s version, as the akka-actor.2.2.3 is for scala 2.10, the 2.0.5 is for scala 2.9.

So finally, I need to change the scalaVersion to 2.9.3, change the akka-actor version to 2.0.5, and it works fine now.

entry.title: sbt-doc.1
entry.content:
Install sbt and import sbt project to eclipse

download sbt-launch.jar, create a script file sbt with content:

SBT_OPTS="-Xms512M -Xmx1536M -Xss1M -XX:+CMSClassUnloadingEnabled -XX:MaxPermSize=256M"
java $SBT_OPTS -jar `dirname $0`/sbt-launch.jar "$@"

make the script executable

chmod u+x sbt

put the directory which contains sbt in PATH env var.

change sbt project to maven project

sbt make-pom

there will be a file in target directory, file name end with pom, copy it to project directory and rename it pom.xml. eclipsify the project:

mvn eclipse:eclipse

import the project to eclipse

entry.title: Manual install apache2 from source code
entry.content:
1. Download apache source code

2. Install

2.1

If you encounter problem like “apr not found”, download the apr source code, extract it, ./configure, make, sudo make install

2.2

If you encounter problem like “apr-utils not found”, download the apr-utils source code, extract it, make, sudo make install.

2.3

If you encounter problem like pcre not found, download the pcre, extract it, make, sudo make install.

then cd into apache source code directory, configure apache again.

then

3. Startup

for convenience, add apache2/bin to PATH.

startup the server

3.1

If you encounter prolblem like libpcre.so.1 not found

a.

check the httpd dependencies:

it will show you the dependencies, find the libpcre.so.1 on you disk, suppose it’s under the /usr/local/lib directory, add a libc.conf file under /etc/ld.so.conf.d directory, add/append the path /usr/local/lib to the end of the file.

If you found there is already a libc.conf file under /etc/ld.so.conf.d directory, skip this step to next.

b.

Then startup the server.

If you encounter the problem like apachectl command not found, replace the apachectl with it’s absolutely path.

4. Uninstall

Check this post

5. Appdendix

http://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/install.html

http://xtony.blog.51cto.com/3964396/836508

http://www.linuxnote.org/installing-apache-apr-not-found-solution-occurs.html

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8501163/error-while-loading-shared-libraries-libpcre-so-0-cannot-open-shared-object-fi

http://www.cnblogs.com/eastson/archive/2012/06/25/2561575.html

http://serverfault.com/questions/191180/what-does-apache2ctl-command-not-found-mean-if-apache-is-installed-and-runni

http://www.cnblogs.com/alexqdh/archive/2012/11/20/2778251.html

entry.title: How to reinstall the system for Motorola XT910 from sdcard on linux
entry.content:
1. Prepare

Firstly, I need the ROM file, as I plan to install miui on my XT910, get it from miui site.

Secondly, I need a recovery app, I found this, RazrBootstrap.apk

Thirdly, as the RazrBootstrap need super user privilege, I need to root my phone, I found a one click root tool.

I also need the android sdk.

2. Steps

2.1 Root the phone, unzip the one click root tool file, set the executable privilege to RootLinux.sh file, then execute it with sh shell:

2.2 After root success, I can find the SuperSu icon/app on my phone, install the recovery apk to sdcard with:

2.3 After install the recovery tool success, we can run it and click Reboot Recovery, double wipes, and install from sdcard.

2.4 Done!

3. Appendix

[ROOT] ROOT DROID RAZR XT910/XT912 [Win/Mac/Linux][2.3.6][ICS]

MOTO XT910刷Recovery教程
